summary: The Clone Sage pu till now hasn’t been as confusing as some might claim (although, I guess I do have the advantage of knowing...
body: The Clone Sage pu till now hasn’t been as confusing as some might claim (although, I guess I do have the advantage of knowing the story, at least in broad strokes), but it does have the problem that the stories and the characterizations therein are all kind of out of tune with each other. In this particular issue, and although I love the man’s work, I felt that, while he had a good handle on Peter and Ben’s feelings, Dematteis couldn’t really manage their moods, especially Ben’s.

reblog.comment: The Clone Sage pu till now hasn’t been as confusing as some might claim (although, I guess I do have the advantage of knowing the story, at least in broad strokes), but it does have the problem that the stories and the characterizations therein are all kind of out of tune with each other. In this particular issue, and although I love the man’s work, I felt that, while he had a good handle on Peter and Ben’s feelings, Dematteis couldn’t really manage their moods, especially Ben’s.

trail.content_raw: The Clone Sage pu till now hasn’t been as confusing as some might claim (although, I guess I do have the advantage of knowing the story, at least in broad strokes), but it does have the problem that the stories and the characterizations therein are all kind of out of tune with each other. In this particular issue, and although I love the man’s work, I felt that, while he had a good handle on Peter and Ben’s feelings, Dematteis couldn’t really manage their moods, especially Ben’s.
trail.content: The Clone Sage pu till now hasn’t been as confusing as some might claim (although, I guess I do have the advantage of knowing the story, at least in broad strokes), but it does have the problem that the stories and the characterizations therein are all kind of out of tune with each other. In this particular issue, and although I love the man’s work, I felt that, while he had a good handle on Peter and Ben’s feelings, Dematteis couldn’t really manage their moods, especially Ben’s.

In this song (translated: They Killed Spider-Man) the singer wonders about who killed Spider-Man and after 27 years (the song was written in 1992) we finally found out.

It. Was. Marvel

blog.name: fluffyseapancakes
blog.title: Tickle Trash Collections
blog.description:
Just a girl trying to improve on her writing and at the same time feed her obsession with fluff. Let's be trash together.
Currently I write for: Supernatural, Fantastic Beasts, Dan and Phil, Teen Wolf, and Avengers. Requests are currently open and I am open to write for any fandom that I'm familiar in. Lots of reader insert fics up ahead! All of my fics are SFW.

summary: Your fics make me SO FLUSTERED! You are an amazing writer and I really enjoy reading your fics. I can tell a lot of people enjoy...
question: Your fics make me SO FLUSTERED! You are an amazing writer and I really enjoy reading your fics. I can tell a lot of people enjoy them! Can you do another platonic Peterxreader where the reader gets playful and attempts to tickle Peter, but due to his spidey strength, he just WRECKS her and teases her a bunch? Thx for taking prompts :)
answer:
THANK YOU <3 here’s a quick fluffy fic, I hope you like it! <33 

_______________________

You observed the rare wild creature in his natural habitat. With enhanced senses and lightning fast reflexes, it was a miracle that the creature hasn’t noticed you yet. You wanted to strike now, but you knew you had to time it exactly right or the creature can easily overpower you, and you knew the consequences would be dire if that happened.

The creature was young and was still learning his physical limits and capabilities, and yet he was already a master with his trade. You have been stalking him for hours now waiting for the perfect moment to strike. He seemed distracted and was completely unaware that you are watching him from only a few feet away.

“Come on,” you whispered through your teeth, your legs were starting to cramp and you’ve been wanting to use the bathroom over an hour ago. Finally as if the heavens was answering to your prayers, the creature turned his body so his back directly faced you.

Perfect.

Without wasting any precious time you leaped out of your hiding place and charged towards the unpredictable and volatile creature, launching yourself into the air, you grunted as you made contact with him at full speed and knocked him to the ground.

“What the hell Y/N?!” Peter Parker screamed, he lay on the ground and clutched his chest to make it stop beating so fast, “Where did you even come from?”

“I was hiding behind the couch,” you grinned, ecstatic that your plan worked, “I’ve been watching you.”

“Jesus Christ for how long?” He groaned, he rubbed a sore spot where the back of his head hit the carpet.

You shrugged, “for a couple hours? Doesn’t matter, I came here to do this!”

At the last word you dug your fingers into Peter’s belly, he bucked up in surprise and bursted out into loud laughter. You laughed victoriously and wildly wiggled your fingers against his sides and belly, taking time to tweak gently at the ribs. He shrieked and grabbed your wrists, a silly grin was on his face and his cheeks were red from laughing.

“Y-Y/N you have made one serious mistake,” he gasped out, you raised your eyebrow and looked at him in confusion.

“What?”

“You didn’t tie me down,” with that he suddenly flipped you over and before even realizing it, you were the one on the floor and Peter loomed over you with a mischievous glint in his eyes. The creature had outsmarted you and you were in huge trouble.

“Sorry?” You squeaked out, you tried to squirm out from under him but he kept you pinned down.

“You should really be more careful when hunting down a creature like me,” he winked at you.

“You knew this whole time I was watching you?! You little sh-,” you couldn’t finish your sentence as Peter mercilessly attacked your weakest spot: your hipbones. He used his thumbs to drill into the perfect spot and you howled with laughter. After torturing that spot for a few minutes, he zeroed in on your belly and his fingers skillfully traced and wiggled along the sensitive skin. Gradually he moved up to your ribs and counted each one slowly, making sure to tweak and tease the spaces in between. You were in absolute hell, you didn’t know how Peter was suddenly much more skilled at tickling and he was making you laugh more than you ever had in your life.

“Do you surrender?” He grinned, worming his hands into your underarms and playfully wiggling his fingers.

“Yes!” You screamed, bucking up at the unbearably ticklish sensation.

“Do you admit I’m the coolest Avenger?”

“F-fine!” You felt your abs cramping up from laughing and fought against his hands, you silently cursed at Peter’s super strength as he held you down with no trouble, “You’re the coolest Avenger!”

“Now that wasn’t so hard,” Peter laughed and stopped his ticklish assault, you immediately curled up and hysterical giggles flowed out of your mouth. He smiled and patted you on the head.
“Next time you try to surprise me, don’t narrate everything like Bear Grylls.”

“Noted,” you wheezed out, you learned one very valuable lesson that day:

Do not poke Spider-Man with a stick.

summary: Wait. So. Doc Ock knows Peter’s identity now???? They can’t even play it off, as they have some other times, as him knowing his...
body:
Wait. So. Doc Ock knows Peter’s identity now???? They can’t even play it off, as they have some other times, as him knowing his face but not who he is, since he knows him. He’s the nephew of the woman he almost married and actually recognized him once when he was in disguise, he knows who he is.

Dang.
